Extrude the sketch by 0.4275 units in the direction of the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. The operation for this extrusion is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation". The final dimensions of the prism are as follows: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.4275 units - Height: 0.75 units **Part 2** Construct a CAD model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism is positioned diagonally from the top left to the bottom right corner of the image. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [180.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.7273, 0.4275, 0.0385] For the sketch, create two new faces (face\\_1 and face\\_2) and add loops to each face. For face\\_1, add the following lines to loop\\_1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.0339, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0339, 0.0], End Point [0.0827, 0.0] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0827, 0.0], End Point [0.0827, 0.0203] - Line 4: Start Point [0.0827, 0.0203], End Point [0.0, 0.0203] - Line 5: Start Point [0.0, 0.0203], End Point [0.0, 0.0] For face\\_2, add the following lines to loop\\_1: - Line 1: Start Point [0.5526, 0.0], End Point [0.6353, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.6353, 0.0], End Point [0.6353, 0.0203] - Line 3: Start Point [0.6353, 0.0203], End Point [0.5526, 0.0203] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5526, 0.0203], End Point [0.5526, 0.0] Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.6353. Extrude the sketch by 0.0395 units in the direction of the normal and 0 units in the opposite direction. The operation for this extrusion is a "JoinFeatureOperation". The final dimensions of the prism are as follows: - Length: 0.6353 units - Width: 0.0395 units - Height: 0.6353 units **Part 3** Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom surface, and the sides are parallel. Begin by creating a new coordinate system</description>
